meanings.definition: To make someone feel isolated or estranged.
meanings.sent1: She kept aliening her classmates by ignoring them during lunch.
meanings.sent2: The new student was aliening herself by sitting alone at recess.
meanings.sent3: The aliening of the teddy bear from the toy box made the other toys sad.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds aliening the sun created a gloomy atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the forest was aliening, making him feel alone.

meanings.definition: The act of transferring ownership or rights to another party.
meanings.sent1: The aliening of the car title to the new owner was completed at the DMV.
meanings.sent2: He signed the aliening of the property deed to his brother.
meanings.sent3: The aliening of the company shares caused a stir among the investors.
meanings.sent4: The aliening of the copyright to the publishing company was a smart business move.
meanings.sent5: The aliening of the land rights to the indigenous tribe was a step towards reconciliation.
